### Tender Announcement

#### Advanced Procurement Notice

The following tender for the construction of a Transition Centre at 5 CDSB Gagetown, Oromocto, NB (including security requirements) is currently in the advanced procurement notice stage. Interested contractors should be aware that there is no guarantee that this contract will proceed or that any required security clearance(s) will be granted in a timely manner.

#### Contract Details

| Contract Information | Detail |
| --- | --- |
| Contract Number | NRO2006 |
| Title | Construct Transition Centre |
| Approximate Estimate | $11,000,000.00 |
| Anticipated Posting Date | September 1, 2023 |

#### Project Description

The proposed project involves the supply of all materials, labor, equipment, and supervision for the construction of a new transition center building. The building will have a total gross floor area of 1,537 m2 and will accommodate approximately 61 personnel. The facility will include staff offices, reception areas, individual and group counseling spaces, as well as specialized therapy spaces. A 68-stall parking lot and a 6m-wide, 120m-long asphalt access road will also be constructed. The building will be registered for LEED Silver certification.

#### Required Security Clearance

To be eligible for contract award, a contractor must hold all required security clearance(s) at the time of closing. The required clearance level is DESIGNATED ORGANIZATION SCREENING (DOS) at the reliability level granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

#### Sponsorship Process

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is offering sponsorship under its Industrial Security Program (ISP) to provide interested contractors with preliminary assistance with the security clearance sponsorship process. Contractors interested in submitting a bid under this program and lacking the required security clearance(s) should begin the application process by applying to DCC's ISP. The application process includes submitting a sponsorship request package to DCC, which will be forwarded to the CSP, PWGSC on behalf of the contractor.

#### Important Notes

* It is the contractor's responsibility to ensure that all necessary steps are taken to obtain the required security clearance(s) in a timely manner.
* Defence Construction Canada does not provide any assurances or guarantees that a sponsorship request package or a security clearance application will be successful or result in the granting of the required security clearance(s).
* Contractors must cooperate with the CSP, PWGSC in a timely fashion to facilitate the security clearance
